citeinfo.origin: PRISM Climate Group at Oregon State University
citeinfo.title: 1991-2020 Mean Annual Extreme Minimum Temperature for the Conterminous US

pubinfo.publish: PRISM Climate Group at Oregon State University

descript.abstract: This dataset represents the mean annual extreme minimum temperature for the 1991-2020 period. The dataset was created by assembling high quality station data of 30-year mean annual extreme minimum temperatures, performing quality control checks of the station data, and interpolating the data using the PRISM modeling system.
descript.purpose: Provide an approved, updated mean annual extreme minimum temperature dataset for the 1991-2020 period with a goal of meeting modern standards of geostatistical analysis and data resolution. The resulting dataset was then used to derive an official USDA-ARS Plant Hardiness Zone Map (PHZM).
descript.supplinf: This is the source 800m resolution raster dataset representing plant hardiness zones in the conterminous US.

idinfo.useconst: Acknowledgement of the following agencies in products derived from these data: PRISM Climate Group at Oregon State University.

attracc.attraccr: Similar quality assurance procedures were used with all input data sets.

dataqual.logic: Point estimates originated from many federal, state, and local weather networks. A list of networks is available from https://www.prism.oregonstate.edu/documents/PRISM_datasets.pdf. All station data were subjected to quality control checks by the PRISM Climate Group at Oregon State University.
dataqual.complete: This dataset is considered complete. Please view the logic section of this document for further information.

horizpa.horizpar: Accuracy of this data set is based on the original specification of the Defense Mapping Agency (DMA) 1 degree digital elevation models (DEM). The stated accuracy of the original DEMs are 130 m circular error with 90% probability.

citeinfo.title: 1991-2020 Mean Annual Extreme Minimum Temperature for the Conterminous US

procstep.procdesc: This dataset was created via the PRISM modeling process. Please view the abstract section of this document for more information.

enttyp.enttypl: Raster data representing mean annual extreme miniumum temperature
enttyp.enttypds: [1] Daly, C., M.P. Widrlechner, M.D. Halbleib, J.I. Smith, and W.P. Gibson. 2012. Development of a new USDA plant hardiness zone map for the United States. Journal of Applied Meteorology and Climatology 51(2): 242-264. doi:10.1175/2010JAMC2536.1. [2] Widrlechner, M.P., C. Daly, M. Keller, and K. Kaplan. 2012. Horticultural applications of a newly revised USDA plant hardiness zone map. HortTechnology 22(1): 6-19. doi:10.21273/HORTTECH.22.1.6.

attr.attrdef: Spatially gridded mean annual extreme minimum temperature values

metainfo.metstdn: FDGC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata and Biological Data Profile
